content:
Hey :wave:,
I would like to help and participate in the simd projects and plans.
Are there still some free spaces for new members?
Yes! we don't have any strict members limit and the task is surely big enough that we'll need the help.
Thatâ€™s nice. Can you or someone else give a quick overview over the current status and plans?

In no particular order, we will
1) Announce ourselves.
2) Build out a std::simd submodule for the compiler.
3) Gradually phase out packed_simd.
4) Provide info on "what even is SIMD?"
Hi @Stu! The broad plan is in our charter. We just had our first meeting this morning. There's a summary here. We also have an announcement in the works with a little more context.
Yeah, current status, "you actually showed up on our first official day"
Haha okay :big_smile:
Even if we literally ran out of things to do, we could always throw you at adjacent issues like const generics and core::arch.
Depending on your background, if you can solve the most recent few issues with packed_simd regarding the MMX stuff causing build error, that'd be grand. But if not that's totally fine too.
retitled topic solely because I expect someone else to come by and wonder what the current status is and hopefully they'll click on the topic named Current status. <_<
Okay I will try to fix some issues (with the bug label I guess) in packed_simd

Specifically this one: https://github.com/rust-lang/packed_simd/issues/288, and if you scroll down in the issue there's already a proposed fix you can try out.

We don't need to fix all the packed_simd bugs, but we at least need to make sure it can build.
